Article Title: KL Rahul : 'Main maar raha tha na' KL on Virat Kohli's dismissal against Australia - watch video
Article Text:
Virat Kohli and KL Rahul during the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 semi-final match against Australia in Dubai. (ANI)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Gautam Gambhir hits out at critics after India beat Australia to reach Champions Trophy final

Virat Kohli steers India to third consecutive Champions Trophy final



Stay tuned for the IND vs AUS Live Score and follow real-time match updates. Get the latest Cricket Live Score and stay ahead with every ball.



During a drinks break in the 40th over of India's chase, KL Rahul spoke with Virat Kohli , appearing to encourage him to stay at the crease until the end. With India requiring 65 runs from 60 balls against Australia on Tuesday, KL Rahul took on the role of aggressor in this Champions Trophy semi-final in Dubai.Rahul quickly scored a four and a six in his next five deliveries to ease the pressure on Kohli. He then rotated the strike to Kohli when India needed 40 runs from 45 balls, with Kohli 16 runs away from his 52nd ODI century.Kohli, despite being in control throughout the chase, attempted an unnecessary slog sweep against Adam Zampa and was caught at long-on. This uncharacteristic dismissal visibly frustrated KL Rahul at the non-striker's end."Main maar raha that naa (I was going after the bowling)," Rahul told Kohli as he walked past him.In the dressing room, coach Gautam Gambhir was also left visibly upset and mumbled something to the support staff and players seated alongside him.After the match, KL Rahul revealed his conversation with Kohli. "When I walked in and when I played 10-12 balls I told him that you're the batter that needs to go on and be there till the end. And let me try and hit or let me try and take one chance an over. Because like you said we only needed 6 runs and over. But 6 runs and over on that wicket seemed like 8-8.5. So, you had to take one chance and over, one boundary or one six," Rahul told Star Sports."So, I told him that I will do that and why don't you just rotate the strike and be there because you're the set batter and it might be harder. If you get out another set batter comes it becomes a lot more harder. But yeah, he felt like it was in his range to hit and yeah he didn't time it well."Rahul maintained his composure and finished unbeaten with 42 runs from 34 balls, securing the victory with a six in the 49th over's first ball. This win advanced India to their fifth Champions Trophy final. Hardik Pandya contributed with a quick 28 runs from 24 balls before his dismissal.Despite the one mistimed shot, Kohli's performance was exceptional. He formed a crucial 91-run partnership for the third wicket with Shreyas Iyer, who scored 45 runs, after the early dismissals of Rohit Sharma (28) and Shubman Gill (9).Although Australia were missing key players, India hadn't defeated them in ICC tournament knockouts since the 2011 World Cup quarterfinal.Kohli effectively handled leg-spinner Adam Zampa, who had previously troubled him. He utilised pull shots and drives between sweeper cover and mid-wicket for consistent scoring.After losing both Iyer and Axar Patel (27) in quick succession, Kohli reached his fifty in 53 balls. Glenn Maxwell dropped a catch when Kohli was on 51 off Cooper Connolly's bowling.Kohli's innings ended when India needed 40 runs to win, as he hit the ball to Ben Dwarshuis at long-on off Zampa's bowling.
Article Summary: Virat Kohli was 16 runs away from his 52nd ODI century. He attempted an unnecessary slog sweep against Adam Zampa and was caught at long-on. This uncharacteristic dismissal visibly frustrated KL Rahul at the non-striker's end. After the match, Rahul revealed his conversation with Kohli.

Article Title: Champions Trophy Final: Over a lakh rush online, tickets sold out in two hours
Article Text:
Indian supporters cheer during the Champions Trophy semi-final match between India and Australia in Dubai, UAE. (PTI)

TimesofIndia.com in Dubai:

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Online queue to buy tickets for the Champions Trophy final.

Tickets for the Champions Trophy final featuring India have been sold out.

Gautam Gambhir hits out at critics after India beat Australia to reach Champions Trophy final



Stay tuned for the IND vs AUS Live Score and follow real-time match updates. Get the latest Cricket Live Score and stay ahead with every ball.



Minutes after the ticket sales for the 2025 Champions Trophy final commenced online, more than 1,00,000 were in the queue to grab their seats for the title clash at the Dubai International Stadium on March 9.With India beating Australia in the first semi-final, the interest for tickets exploded in no time and even the teams handling the backend operations were surprised to see the interest and the massive queue.In little over two hours, the tickets which went for sale online were sold out and the fans can now try their luck for physical tickets at the Box Office. As many as 12 categories of tickets went for sale and even the most expensive tickets - priced at AED 12,000 each (approx Rs 3,00,000) - were sold out at lightning quick time. The cheapest category was AED 250 with the premium categories starting from AED 1,000.Except for the games vs Bangladesh and New Zealand, it was nearly a packed stadium in the games vs Pakistan and Australia. During an interaction with the media on March 2, Emirates Cricket Board (ECB) COO Subhan Ahmed had explained how the crowds have picked up as the tournament progressed.“The crowds have picked up gradually. It (for the India vs Bangladesh match) was more than 60% (turnout). Some countries are facing challenges to travel, which could be a factor. However, the turnout for the subsequent matches has been very good. The ticket sales were around 95% (of the capacity). Maybe, some people didn’t turn up after buying the tickets! Today (March 2), there’s around a 93% turnout, and it will increase as the day wears on,” he said.Ahmed had emphasised that the pricing has been kept very competitive and the turnout during Ramadan has been very encouraging."It's the second day of Ramadan, and the stadium is almost full. Pricing of the tickets is not an issue," Ahmed added.
Article Summary: Tickets for the Champions Trophy final featuring India have been sold out. As many as 12 categories of tickets went for sale and even the most expensive tickets - priced at AED 12,000 each (approx Rs 3,00,000) - were sold out at lightning quick time. The cheapest category was AED 250 with the premium categories starting from AED 1,000.

Article Title: Shahabuddin Razvi slams Mohammed Shami for not observing 'roza' during India-Australia match
Article Text:
'Religion should not be mixed with sports'

'Nobody has a right to raise a finger on him'

NEW DELHI: The national president of All India Muslim Jamaat , Maulana Shahabuddin Razvi , on Wednesday criticised cricketer Mohammed Shami after a video of him drinking an energy drink during the Champions Trophy semifinal match against Australia in the UAE went viral, even as the Muslim community was observing Ramadan fasting.In a video shared by news agency ANI, Razvi stated, "One of the compulsory duties is 'Roza' (fasting)...If any healthy man or woman doesn't observe 'roza', they will be a big criminal. A famous cricket personality of India, Mohammed Shami had water or some other beverage during a match."Highlighting that Shami was physically fit to play, Razvi further said, "People were watching him. If he is playing, it means he is healthy. In such a condition, he did not observe 'Roza' and even had water...This sends a wrong message among people.""By not keeping 'roza', he has committed a crime. He should not do this. In the eyes of Shariat, he is a criminal. He will have to answer God."NCP-SCP MLA Rohit Pawar came out in support of Shami, asserting that the Indian cricketer prioritises his performance over fasting. Pawar stressed that religion should not be intertwined with sports and highlighted that the Muslim community takes pride in Shami’s accomplishments."While representing the country, if Mohammad Shami feels that his performance might get even slightly affected due to fasting and what if something happens, then he will never be able to sleep. He is a hardcore Indian who has made the team win many times. Religion should not be brought up in sports. If you ask any Muslim person today, he/she will say that they are proud of Mohammad Shami," Pawar stated.Executive Member of the All India Muslim Personal Law Board, Maulana Khalid Rashid Farangi Mahli, defended Shami, stating that fasting is compulsory for Muslims, but there are exceptions."It is compulsory for all Muslims to observe roza, especially in the month of Ramazan. However, Allah has clearly mentioned in the Quran that if a person is on a journey or not well, they have the option not to observe Roza. In the case of Mohammed Shami, he is on a tour, so he has the option not to observe Roza. Nobody has a right to raise a finger on him," he said.Shami delivered an impressive performance, conceding only 27 runs in his first seven overs. Utilising his experience, he outfoxed Australian batters with variations in speed, line and length, finishing with figures of 3/48 in 10 overs.
Article Summary: All India Muslim Jamaat national president Maulana Shahabuddin Razvi criticised cricketer Mohammed Shami after a video of him drinking an energy drink went viral. Razvi: "One of the compulsory duties is 'Roza' (fasting)...If any healthy man or woman doesn't observe 'roza', they will be a big criminal" NCP-SCP MLA Rohit Pawar came out in support of Shami, asserting that the Indian cricketers prioritises his performance over fasting.

Article Title: "Agree with him": Wayne Gretzky faces fresh support and backlash after Premier Doug Ford defends him

Canadian Premier Doug Ford Supports Wayne Gretzky And Fans Have A Lot To Say

A third fan wrote, “Actually agree with him on this”.However, some fans have continued to slam Wayne Gretzky. A fan commented, “You were doing great until you brought up Gretzky. Sorry Doug, you lost me there.”Another fan wrote, “Doug Ford can STOP telling people what to say and what to do”.At the 4 Nations Face Off’s final match, when Team Canada faced Team USA, it was reported that Wayne Gretzky had showed a “thumbs up” and smiled at Team USA. Article Title: Alexander Ovechkin: Who is Alexander Ovechkin's wife? Everything to Know About Anastasia Shubskaya
Article Text:

From Switzerland to Russia: Anastasia Shubskaya’s Early Life

More Than Just a Pretty Face: Anastasia Shubskaya's Career in Modeling and Film

Love at Second Sight: Anastasia Shubskaya and Alexander Ovechkin's Love Story

A Growing Family: Ovechkin and Anastasia 's Children

When we talk about Alexander Ovechkin , it's usually about his blistering slap shots and record-breaking goals, but let’s switch gears and shine the spotlight on the woman behind the hockey legend — Anastasia Shubskaya , or as she’s known now, Nastasiya Ovechkina. So, who is the powerhouse supporting Ovi off the ice? Let’s break it down.Born on November 16, 1993, in Switzerland, Anastasia Shubskaya is the daughter of Kirill Shubsky, a prominent Russian businessman, and Vera Glagoleva, a celebrated Russian actress and film director. Though she spent part of her childhood in Switzerland, her roots firmly planted themselves in Russia, where she grew up alongside her sisters, Anna and Maria.Tragically, Anastasia lost her mother to cancer in 2017, a heartbreak that further fueled her passion for cinema — a world her mother so deeply influenced.Anastasia isn’t just known for being Ovechkin’s wife — she’s carved out her own path in the world of modeling, acting, and film production. She graduated from the Gerasimov Institute of Cinematography in 2014 and later pursued an acting program at the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles.Her modeling career took off in Russia, with appearances in various high-end magazines, and she continues to be a familiar face both in front of the camera and behind the scenes, blending beauty with brains and creativity.Their love story is straight out of a rom-com. Anastasia and Alexander first crossed paths at the 2008 Beijing Olympics but didn't start dating until 2014 — thanks to a little social media magic. A few DMs and heart-fluttering conversations later, the pair reconnected and didn’t look back.Fast forward to July 2016, and the couple tied the knot in an intimate ceremony, only to follow it up with a lavish celebration in July 2017 at the Barvikha Luxury Village near Moscow. Talk about a fairytale wedding!Family means everything to the Ovechkins. The couple are proud parents to two adorable sons — Sergei Aleksandrovich Ovechkin (born August 2018) and Ilya Aleksandrovich Ovechkin (born May 2020). Their first son was named in honor of Alexander's late brother, adding a heartfelt layer to their family story.While Anastasia is often recognized as the wife of one of the NHL's greatest players, she’s more than just a hockey wife — she’s a model, actress, and loving mother, all while supporting Alexander as he chases hockey history.So next time Ovi lights up the scoreboard, just remember — there's an equally impressive force cheering him on from the stands.Also read - Can Alex Ovechkin Overtake Wayne Gretzky's Goal Record With 20 Games Left in the NHL Season?
Article Summary: Anastasia Shubskaya is the wife of NHL star Alexander Ovechkin. She is also a model, actress, and mother to two sons. Her mother, Vera Glagoleva, was a celebrated Russian actress and film director. She lost her mother to cancer in 2017.

Article Title: NBA Trade Rumors: Los Angeles Lakers might reunite with $3 million shooting guard before playoffs to support LeBron James and Luka Doncic

The Los Angeles Lakers are making strategic moves as they gear up for the playoffs, with reports indicating that Jordan Goodwin ’s two-way contract will soon be converted into a standard NBA deal. This decision comes as the team continues its impressive run, winning seven straight games and 18 of their last 21. To make room for Goodwin, the Lakers are likely to waive either Cam Reddish or Alex Len, with Reddish being the more probable candidate.Jordan Goodwin, a 26-year-old guard, has quickly become a valuable asset for the Los Angeles Lakers since joining the team in early February. Over eight games, he has averaged 6.1 points, 3.8 rebounds, and 1.0 assist in 16.9 minutes per game. Despite a recent right ankle sprain slowing his momentum, Goodwin’s contributions have not gone unnoticed. Head coach JJ Redick has repeatedly praised him, calling him a key rotation player.According to The Athletic’s Jovan Buha, the Los Angeles Lakers are expected to convert Goodwin’s contract as late as possible to maximize financial flexibility. "I do expect him to be converted at the end of the season as late as possible, and then be on the playoff roster. ... He's kind of become the 9th man, and you could argue that depending on the night and depending on the matchup, he should be like the 8th man," Buha said on his podcast . He also hinted at a potential multi-year deal for Goodwin in the future, stating, "I think he's going to get a multi-year contract, longer-term later in the season."Jordan Goodwin’s journey to the Lakers began after they waived Armel Traore to open a roster spot. A four-year NBA veteran, he has previously played for Washington, Phoenix, and Memphis, holding career averages of 6.4 points, 3.8 rebounds, and 2.6 assists across 128 games. Brady Tkachuk recently called out the Vancouver Canucks , suggesting they blocked Quinn Hughes from playing in the 4 Nations Face-Off for Team USA. We can’t even play the guy, so how was he going to play for the Americans?”Quinn Hughes was off the ice from Jan 31 to Feb 26, making Brady Tkachuk’s claim questionable. Since returning, he’s played three games, with two losses and one assist. His injury remains unchanged, suggesting health, not interference, kept him out.Brady Tkachuk didn’t hold back when he appeared on Spittin’ Chiclets’ YouTube channel, sharing strong opinions on the 4 Nations Face-Off and the Quinn Hughes situation. “I actually FaceTimed Quinn. Kinda like when he was figuring it out when people were like, ‘Quinn might come, Quinn might not come, ’” Brady said.He continued, “I think he was all about coming, but I just don’t think he got cleared by Vancouver to play. Article Title: Kyle Kuzma drops 5-word reaction to his fiancée Winnie Harlow’s revelation about his proposal

Winnie Harlow: My Engagement Story (Full Episode)

Milwaukee Bucks starhas recently reacted to his fiancéeas she details the 29-year-old forward’s proposal in a recent interview. Recently, Kuzma took a significant step in his relationship, proposing to longtime girlfriend Winnie Harlow in a beautifully orchestrated moment that left the model in tears. The couple, who have been dating since 2020, shared their engagement story, revealing the intimate details of Kuzma’s grand yet heartfelt gesture.During her guest appearance on Call Her Daddy, model and entrepreneur Winnie Harlow shared the story behind her engagement to NBA star Kyle Kuzma . Before the episode aired, the podcast released a teaser where she hinted at the special moment. Kuzma later reacted to the clip on his Instagram story, playfully teasing the reveal with a laughing emoji and writing, “Can’t wait to watch it,” while tagging his fiancée.Speaking on Alex Cooper’s Call Her Daddy podcast, Harlow confessed, “I was the last one to know about it. Everyone on my whole team was like, ‘Did you not realize that we’ve been avoiding you for the last two weeks?’”The surprise began before they even reached their destination. Kuzma had rented a private jet and decorated it lavishly with roses, chocolates, balloons, and champagne, setting the tone for a magical moment. “I was the last one to know about it,” she said of the proposal. "Everyone on my whole team was like, ‘Did you not realize that we’ve been avoiding you for the last two weeks?’ I was like, ‘Well, I was none the wiser,’” Harlow added.As they boarded the decorated jet, Harlow was already moved to tears. But the real surprise came when Kuzma pulled out a heartfelt poem he had written for her. The model had once jokingly asked Kuzma to send her a love letter, not realizing he would turn it into one of the most meaningful moments of their relationship.“I was like, ‘Write me a love letter, my sergeant. Send me a love letter,’ and it was just a joke, you know, but he took that and wrote me a love letter to propose,” Harlow shared. At the end of the poem, instead of the expected question, “Will you be my Valentine?” Kuzma instead asked, “Will you be my wife?”“I literally just went into shock,” she admitted. “I was already crying and just flooded with tears at that point. He pulled out the box, got on one knee, and I was like, ‘Yes. I don’t even need to see it … Yes, yes, yes.’”Kuzma had been planning the proposal for six months. He even arranged for Harlow’s nail technician to fly from Los Angeles to Washington, D.C., to make sure she had her nails done before the big moment. The centerpiece of the proposal was an 8.5-carat oval-cut diamond ring, which Kuzma spent three months designing. “I just wanted to draw a picture of what I felt resembled her—something that was elegant, but very timeless and simplistic at the same time,” he told Vogue.Initially, Kuzma had planned to propose in Turks and Caicos with both of their families present, but at the last moment, he decided to keep it intimate and pop the question on the plane. “I love that he did that. It was so beautiful, so romantic, it was just him and I,” Harlow said.Also Read: Giannis Antetokounmpo gives honest reaction after joining elite 20,000 points club Harlow and Kuzma’s love story began in 2020, but it almost didn’t happen. During a 2021 interview, Harlow revealed that Kuzma had originally messaged her a year prior, but she never saw it. It wasn’t until he messaged again during the pandemic that their relationship finally took off.
Article Summary: Kyle Kuzma proposed to longtime girlfriend Winnie Harlow on a private jet. The Milwaukee Bucks star spent six months designing an 8.5-carat oval-cut diamond ring. Harlow shared the intimate details of the proposal on Alex Cooper’s Call Her Daddy.

THE GR8 CHASE for Victory Over Cancer

"There is so much attention on the chase, so I'm using that to help. We should all help and make cancer go away,"

"Our team has been doing a good job my whole career to try and help kids battling cancer. I can see all the times we go to hospitals to visit the kids, or they come to see us at practice or after games, they always have smiles,"

Washington Capitals ownership is putting real money behind Alexander Ovechkin’s donations—every dollar he gives, they’ll match

Alexander Ovechkin is 11 goals away from breaking Wayne Gretzky’s all-time NHL goals record . But this isn’t just about making history. Every goal he scores from Wednesday’s game against the New York Rangers until the end of his career will directly contribute to pediatric cancer research .Washington Capitals announced that Ovechkin is partnering with the NHL’s Hockey Fights Cancer initiative and The V Foundation, turning his record chase into a larger mission. His campaign,, will see him donate a dollar amount equal to his total career goals after every game. If he scores his 885th career goal on Wednesday, he donates $885. Fans can chip in too through the campaign’s official page.Ovechkin said (h/t ESPN).This isn't just PR. Ovechkin has been actively involved in cancer awareness efforts for years, frequently visiting children’s hospitals and meeting young fans battling the disease.Ovechkin has 21 games left in the regular season. That’s plenty of time to close the gap and surpass Gretzky before the Stanley Cup Playoffs. If he doesn’t make it this season, he still has all of next year to shatter the record. And if he pushes beyond 894? He could be the first NHL player to ever reach 900 career goals.This record was once considered untouchable. Now, it’s within reach.Ovechkin said.Ovechkin isn’t the only one stepping up. Monumental Sports and Entertainment, which owns the Washington Capitals, will match every dollar he donates through the end of his career.That means if Ovechkin breaks the record with 895 goals, the total donation doubles—both from him and the organization backing him.This isn’t just about making history in hockey. It’s about making an impact beyond the rink.
Article Summary: Alexander Ovechkin is 11 goals away from breaking Wayne Gretzky’s all-time NHL goals record. Article Text:

DUBAI: Indian pacer Mohammed Shami ’s call to remove the ban on saliva so that fast bowlers can generate reverse swing again, has found many takers. Shami’s appeal finds resonance among experts as there is a feeling to restore some sort of a level-playing field.Former India fast bowler and ex-national selector Salil Ankola told TOI: “They should do away with this ban now. I completely second Shami on that. You have got everything going for the batters, at least something should be there for the bowlers too.” Ankola, who played 20 ODIs for India, mentioned how this ban remains on most bowlers’ minds.“I was talking about it while commentating in the Ranji Trophy finals recently. The use of saliva to shine the ball has been going on for a century! It was not even banned in 1920, when a pandemic struck! Covid is over now. It’s time to do away with it,” he said.While they had first imposed the ban on using saliva to polish the ball in May 2020 during the Covid-19 pandemic, in September 2022, the ICC made the ban permanent.Shami’s appeal to the game’s authorities has been also backed by two former international bowlers in South Africa’s Vernon Philander and New Zealand’s Tim Southee , who feel that allowing bowlers to use saliva will give a rebirth to reverse swing, currently missing from the game, especially on flat surfaces, on which most of One-day cricket is played on these days.“I think as a bowler, you want to have a slight advantage. We see the game going the way it’s going and seeing sides score 362 (New Zealand’s semifinal total against South Africa) and often, over 300 in this format. I think there needs to be something in the bowlers’ favour, and whether that’s a little bit of saliva. I don’t see why they couldn’t afford to get that back in,” Southee said on ESPNcricinfo’s Match Day.Philander said, “If we look at the state of that ball, towards the back end, it was really scuffed up. And I think had you used the saliva (to polish one side of the ball), the element of the reverse swing might have come into play.”‘Need to be cautious while lifting ban’However, there was a voice of caution too.“While I think that Shami has made a very valid call, we need to have a harder look at this issue before arriving at a decision,” former India pacer Venkatesh Prasad said.“The ban on applying saliva on the ball was also about maintaining cleanliness. Anything can happen today, we don’t know how many and when a new virus enters the air. So, I think you need to be very careful in making a decision about lifting the ban.”
Article Summary: Mohammed Shami has called on the ICC to remove the ban on saliva. The ban was imposed during the Covid-19 pandemic in 2022. Shami’s appeal has been backed by two former international bowlers. Vernon Philander and Tim Southee feel that allowing bowlers to use saliva will give a rebirth to reverse swing.

Article Title: "He is a leader": NFL Icon Rob Gronkowski snubs Travis Kelce while naming a surprise pick for the hardest tight end to tackle
Article Text:

Rob Gronkowski Drops a Surprise Pick for the Hardest Tight End to Tackle—And It’s Not Travis Kelce!



Ranking the The Hardest-Hitting Tight Ends & O-Lines in Football | Dudes On Dudes

George Kittle’s Monster Season and Contract Implications



The 2024 NFL season was anticipated to be a breakthrough year for tight ends, but despite several players having standout campaigns, the expected takeover didn’t fully materialize. Among those who continued to deliver strong performances was Travis Kelce . However, his numbers reflected a decline from his usual elite standards, highlighting the rise of another dominant force—George Kittle.At 35, Travis Kelce’s impact remained significant, but his production dipped compared to his previous seasons. With 97 receptions, his catch total ranked 12th in the league, yet his 823 receiving yards and 8.5 yards per reception were his lowest since his rookie season. The decline in explosiveness was evident as Kelce transitioned into more of a short-yardage safety valve rather than the dynamic open-field threat he once was.This shift played a role in his omission from the Dudes on Dudes podcast’s All-Dude first team. Rob Gronkowski and Julian Edelman had no hesitation in naming Kittle as their top tight end. Gronkowski explained their reasoning by praising Kittle’s relentless effort and physicality on the field.“I truly believe [George Kittle] earned it this year… George is in his 30s now, and the way that he plays the game, he still plays it like he’s 22 years old out on that field. He’s running hard. It’s hard to tackle him, and he’s blocking like an absolute vicious maniac out there… he’s giving it his all every play, and he’s a leader.”Despite missing two games due to a hamstring injury, Kittle’s numbers were among the best at the position. His 1,106 receiving yards were the second-highest of his career, while his 78 catches and eight touchdowns further solidified his status as an elite tight end. His ability to stretch the field was unmatched, leading all tight ends with 14.2 yards per reception.Recognized for his outstanding season, Kittle earned second-team All-Pro honors, a Pro Bowl selection, and the Len Eshmont Award as the 49ers' most valuable player. Head coach Kyle Shanahan acknowledged his vital role in the team’s success.“He’s had a hell of a year. He’s been able to stay healthy, too. He’s missed two games, I believe, which were obviously tough without him. But I’ve just been proud of how he’s taken care of himself, the way he comes to work every single day. I love being around George and love having him on our team.”As George Kittle remains one of the NFL’s premier tight ends, his contract situation becomes a key discussion point. The 49ers have restructured his five-year, $75 million extension multiple times to create cap space. However, in 2025, he is set to carry a cap hit of $22.085 million—nearly $10 million more than his previous high. A contract extension seems like the logical solution for both the team and the player.Kittle has made it clear that he envisions finishing his career with the 49ers.“Whatever the front office wants to do, I’m all ears,” he told ESPN.Beyond financial considerations, Kittle’s career trajectory continues to trend toward greatness. In 2024, he surpassed 7,380 receiving yards, setting a 49ers franchise record for tight ends and ranking second only to Kelce for the most receiving yards at the position through eight seasons. His name is now firmly etched among legends, joining the likes of Tony Gonzalez, Jason Witten, and Rob Gronkowski as one of only five tight ends with four 1,000-yard seasons.Each season, Kittle sets personal goals—1,000 receiving yards, 10 touchdowns, and 75 receptions. If he maintains this pace for three more years, he would cement his legacy among the top six tight ends in history. Paired with his elite blocking ability, this would almost guarantee a Hall of Fame induction, though Kittle remains focused on the present.“It’s always been until the wheels fall off,” he stated. “Or until my wife tells me to stop playing, which I’ll trust her on that one.”Also Read: "Zip it": Joe Burrow gets ruthlessly trolled for "overconfident" remarks in resurfaced interviews and faces criticism With no signs of slowing down, Kittle is on a path to not only make his place as a 49ers legend but also stake his claim as one of the greatest tight ends in NFL history.
Article Summary: Travis Kelce's numbers reflected a decline from his usual elite standards. The decline played a role in his omission from the Dudes on Dudes podcast’s All-Dude first team. The 49ers have restructured his five-year, $75 million extension multiple times to create cap space.

The board wanted to see how the team fared in the Champions Trophy after a disastrous Test season.It is learnt that the board wanted to revisit the Grade A+ contracts. Currently, Rohit, Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah and Ravindra Jadeja make up the top grade.With BCCI’s policy suggesting that players performing in all three formats are preferred for A+ contracts, there were some concerns with Rohit, Kohli and Jadeja retiring from T20Is and also enduring a very rough Test season. However, a strong showing in the Champions Trophy could help these players retain the marquee contract.It will be interesting to see if Axar Patel, KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant are promoted to A category. Article Summary: The outcome of Sunday's ICC Champions Trophy final is likely to form the base for Indian cricket’s preparation for the ODI World Cup in 2027 and the next World Test Championship (WTC) cycle. It could determine the future course for captain Rohit Sharma with the Indian cricket board (BCCI) keen on having a stable leadership. The board has also held back announcing the fresh central contracts and will wait for the final against New Zealand.
